items.title: A Question Hidden in the Platypus Genome: Are We the Weird Ones?
items.author: Cara Giaimo
items.description: When the British zoologist George Shaw first encountered a platypus specimen in 1799, he was so befuddled that he checked for stitches, thinking someone might be trying to trick him with a Frankencreature. It’s hard to blame him: What other animal has a rubbery bill, ankle spikes full of venom, …

items.title: Why our understanding of 'Survival of the Fittest' is wrong - BBC Reel
items.author: BBC World
items.description: Few phrases in science are as influential as Charles Darwin’s evolutionary theory of 'survival of the fittest'. The idea is commonly understood to mean that those who are physically dominant have a higher chance of survival. But the evolutionary success of Homo Sapiens suggests that we might have …

items.title: 6 Months Later, Covid Survivors Plagued by Health Problems
